verses.verse: And it came to pass in those days<WH3117>, that the Philistines<WH6430> gathered<WH6908> their armies<WH4264> together<WH6908> for warfare<WH6635>, to fight<WH3898> with Israel<WH3478>. And Achish<WH397> said<WH559> unto David<WH1732>, Know<WH3045> you assuredly<WH3045>, that you shall go out<WH3318> with me to battle<WH4264>, you and your men<WH582>.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Achish<WH397>, Surely<WH3651> you shall know<WH3045> what your servant<WH5650> can do<WH6213>. And Achish<WH397> said<WH559> to David<WH1732>, Therefore will I make<WH7760> you keeper<WH8104> of my head<WH7218> for ever<WH3117>.

Now Samuel<WH8050> was dead<WH4191>, and all Israel<WH3478> had lamented<WH5594> him<WH6912>, and buried him in Ramah<WH7414>, even in his own city<WH5892>. And Saul<WH7586> had put away<WH5493> those that had familiar spirits<WH178>, and the wizards<WH3049>, out of the land<WH776>.

And the Philistines<WH6430> gathered themselves together<WH6908>, and came<WH935> and pitched<WH2583> in Shunem<WH7766>: and Saul<WH7586> gathered<WH6908> all Israel<WH3478> together<WH6908>, and they pitched<WH2583> in Gilboa<WH1533>.
And when Saul<WH7586> saw<WH7200> the army<WH4264> of the Philistines<WH6430>, he was afraid<WH3372>, and his heart<WH3820> greatly<WH3966> trembled<WH2729>.
And when Saul<WH7586> inquired<WH7592> of the Lord<WH3068>, the Lord<WH3068> answered<WH6030> him not<WH2472>, neither by dreams, nor by Urim<WH224>, nor by prophets<WH5030>.

Then said<WH559> Saul<WH7586> unto his servants<WH5650>, Seek<WH1245> me a woman<WH802> that has<WH1172> a familiar spirit<WH178>, that I may go<WH3212> to her<WH1875>, and inquire of her<WH5650>. And his servants said<WH559> to him<WH802>, Behold, there is a woman that has<WH1172> a familiar spirit<WH178> at Endor<WH5874>.

And Saul<WH7586> disguised<WH2664> himself<WH3847>, and put on other<WH312> clothes<WH899>, and he went<WH3212>, and two<WH8147> men<WH582> with him<WH935>, and they came to the woman<WH802> by night<WH3915>: and he said<WH559>, I pray you<WH7080>, divine unto me by the familiar spirit<WH178>, and bring me him up<WH5927>, whom I shall name unto you<WH559>.

And the woman<WH802> said<WH559> unto him<WH3045>, Behold, you know what Saul<WH7586> has done<WH6213>, how he has cut off<WH3772> those that have familiar spirits<WH178>, and the wizards<WH3049>, out of the land<WH776>: that is why then lay you a snare<WH5367> for my life<WH5315>, to cause me to die<WH4191>?
And Saul<WH7586> swore<WH7650> to her by the Lord<WH3068>, saying<WH559>, As the Lord<WH3068> lives<WH2416>, there shall<WH518> no punishment<WH5771> happen<WH7136> to you for this thing<WH1697>.
Then said<WH559> the woman<WH802>, Whom shall I bring up<WH5927> unto you<WH559>? And he said, Bring me up<WH5927> Samuel<WH8050>.

And when the woman<WH802> saw<WH7200> Samuel<WH8050>, she cried<WH2199> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963>: and the woman<WH802> spoke<WH559> to Saul<WH7586>, saying<WH559>, Why have you deceived<WH7411> me<WH7586>? for you are Saul.

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto her<WH3372>, Be not afraid: for what saw<WH7200> you<WH802>? And the woman said<WH559> unto Saul<WH7586>, I saw<WH7200> gods<WH430> ascending<WH5927> out of the earth<WH776>.

And he said<WH559> unto her<WH8389>, What form is he of<WH559>? And she said, An old<WH2205> man<WH376> comes up<WH5927>; and he is covered<WH5844> with a mantle<WH4598>. And Saul<WH7586> perceived<WH3045> that it was Samuel<WH8050>, and he stooped<WH6915> with his face<WH639> to the ground<WH776>, and bowed himself<WH7812>.

And Samuel<WH8050> said<WH559> to Saul<WH7586>, Why have you troubled<WH7264> me<WH5927>, to bring me up? And Saul<WH7586> answered<WH559>, I am severe<WH3966> distressed<WH6887>; for the Philistines<WH6430> make war<WH3898> against me<WH430>, and God is departed<WH5493> from me<WH6030>, and answers me no more<WH3027>, neither by prophets<WH5030>, nor by dreams<WH2472>: therefore I have called<WH7121> you<WH3045>, that you may make known unto me what I shall do<WH6213>.
Then said<WH559> Samuel<WH8050>, That is why then you ask<WH7592> of me<WH3068>, seeing the Lord is departed<WH5493> from you<WH6145>, and is become your enemy?

And the Lord<WH3068> has done<WH6213> to him<WH1696>, as he spoke by me<WH3027>: for the Lord<WH3068> has tore<WH7167> the kingdom<WH4467> out of your hand<WH3027>, and given<WH5414> it to your neighbor<WH7453>, even to David<WH1732>:

Because<WH834> you obeyed<WH8085> not the voice<WH6963> of the Lord<WH3068>, nor executed<WH6213> his fierce<WH2740> wrath<WH639> upon Amalek<WH6002>, therefore has the Lord<WH3068> done<WH6213> this thing<WH1697> unto you this day<WH3117>.

Moreover the Lord<WH3068> will also deliver<WH5414> Israel<WH3478> with you into the hand<WH3027> of the Philistines<WH6430>: and to morrow<WH4279> shall you and your sons<WH1121> be with me<WH3068>: the Lord also shall deliver<WH5414> the army<WH4264> of Israel<WH3478> into the hand<WH3027> of the Philistines<WH6430>.

Then Saul<WH7586> fell<WH5307> directly<WH4116> all<WH4393> along<WH6967> on the earth<WH776>, and was very<WH3966> afraid<WH3372>, because of the words<WH1697> of Samuel<WH8050>: and there was no strength<WH3581> in him<WH398>; for he had eaten no bread<WH3899> all the day<WH3117>, nor all the night<WH3915>.

And the woman<WH802> came<WH935> unto Saul<WH7586>, and saw<WH7200> that he was very<WH3966> troubled<WH926>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH8198>, Behold, your handmaid has obeyed<WH8085> your voice<WH6963>, and I have put<WH7760> my life<WH5315> in my hand<WH3709>, and have listened<WH8085> unto your words<WH1697> which you spoke unto me<WH1696>.

Now therefore<WH8085>, I pray you, listen you also unto the voice<WH6963> of your handmaid<WH8198>, and let me set<WH7760> a morsel<WH6595> of bread<WH3899> before<WH6440> you<WH398>; and eat, that you may have strength<WH3581>, when you go<WH3212> on your way<WH1870>.

But he refused<WH3985>, and said<WH559>, I will not eat<WH398>. But his servants<WH5650>, together with the woman<WH802>, compelled<WH6555> him<WH8085>; and he listened unto their voice<WH6963>. So he arose<WH6965> from the earth<WH776>, and sat<WH3427> upon the bed<WH4296>.

And the woman<WH802> had a fat<WH4770> calf<WH5695> in the house<WH1004>; and she hurried<WH4116>, and killed<WH2076> it<WH3947>, and took flour<WH7058>, and kneaded<WH3888> it<WH644>, and did bake unleavened bread there<WH4682>:
And she brought<WH5066> it before<WH6440> Saul<WH7586>, and before<WH6440> his servants<WH5650>; and they did eat<WH398>. Then they rose up<WH6965>, and went away<WH3212> that night<WH3915>.
